editorialNotes.standard: A sleek interface and robust tools transform potato-quality images into stunning works of art with a few taps, along with the freedom to experiment without damaging the original photo.

Powered by the same code base that drives the iconic desktop image editor, the iPadOS version adds a customisable interface optimised for touch and Apple Pencil. Explore all that’s new with lessons on masking, composites and more.

editorialNotes.standard: This app offers the flexibility you’ve always wished for when taking notes on longer documents. Quickly drag excerpts to a separate workspace, make comments, compare distant sections and more. You’ll forget how you ever read without it.

editorialNotes.standard: Few things are more relaxing than settling down with a good coloring book—at least, until the kid we borrowed it from asks for it back. Pigment unleashes our grown-up creative energy with a surprisingly deep array of artist’s tools and tweaks. It even lets us automatically color within the lines, giving our productions a sheen of perfection. We expect a call from the gallery any day now.
editorialNotes.short: Get cracking with colours.

editorialNotes.standard: Re-imagined from the ground up for mobile, Adobe’s creative powerhouse feels like a fresh way to experience a familiar tool. The time to create is now.

Here’s a simple truth: we don’t work with documents on mobile the same way we do on desktop. So it makes sense that Microsoft reimagined Office for a uniquely mobile experience where being productive feels frictionless.
editorialNotes.short: Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
